p: α-Pinene was determined to be enantiomerically pure (100%) for their (−) form or (−)-α-pinene exceeded (+)-α-pinene by 3 to 12.2 times (i.e., the racemic composition of α-pinene) ( Table S3). The purity of 74.8% for the (1S)-(−) enantiomer in enantiomeric racemates of α-pinene was the lowest. Both enantiomers were interdependent, i.e., an increase in (1S)-(−) enantiomeric form in α-pinene fraction was always accompanied by a decrease in (1R)-(+) enantiomeric form (r = −0.95, p < 0.05). The percentage of (1R)-(+)-α-pinene weakly correlated with the percentages of essential oil and α-pinene (r = 0.29, p < 0.05 and r = 0.27, p < 0.05, respectively).
